intro: Phyllanthus subapicalis subsp. subapicalis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spurge, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, opposite, and often narrow leaves. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. The plant is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap, which is also present in this species. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it identifiable by its distinctive leaf morphology and floral structure.
